name: All-or-nothing thinking
summary: You look at things in absolute, black-and-white categories, using absolute terms like never or always.

name: Over-generalization
summary: You com.mindbuilders.cognitivemoodlog.view an event as a never-ending pattern of defeat.

name: Mental Filter
summary: You dwell on the negatives of a situation or a person and ignore the positives.

name: Discounting positives
summary: You dismiss the positive qualities of yourself or the positive qualities of others.

name: Jumping to Conclusions
summary: You assume an outcome without evidence for it.

name: Mind-reading
summary: You assume that people are either reacting or will react negatively to you.

name: Magnification or minimization
summary: You blow things way out of proportion in either direction.

name: Emotional Reasoning
summary: You reason from your feelings. For example, dreading budgeting might cause you to think that "my finances are impossible to manage".

name: Should statements
summary: You use words or phrases including "shoulds", should nots", "musts", and "have tos".

name: Labeling
summary: Linking your's or another's personality to the situation.  For example, instead of saying "I didn't do it right", you tell yourself "I am a failure".

name: Self-blame
summary: You take the blame of the situation even if you were not entirely responsible

name: Other-blame
summary: Others are held responsible for negative situations or for your feelings
